website_summaries.verdict: A quiet and affordable option that is both easy to work with and versatile.
pros: Comes with 8 gigabytes of UDIMM RAM, a 1 terabyte 7200 rpm drive, and an Intel Xeon E3-1225 v5 3.3 gigahertz processor
Easy to work with, and has good speed and versatility
cons: Power button blends in a bit too much with the case — hard to see in low-light conditions
Does not come with an operating system
Some reports of this option arriving with a bad drive

customer_reviews.title: Budget Gaming System for sub $700 (With NVMe Support!)
customer_reviews.text: By downgrading the BIOS to version 1.0.0, you will not only gain sleep/wake support (that you shouldn't use anyway) but also enable the M.2 port on the motherboard. This will allow you to install an NVMe SSD and really unlock the potential a device at this price point has. I've coupled it with a Samsung 970 EVO 250GB and an EVGA Geforce GTX 1050 ti graphics card (both of which running with the stock PSU) and for the money am really pleased with the performance.
customer_reviews.author: Server Suplex

customer_reviews.title: Great server. Use this to run my Plex Media ...
customer_reviews.text: Great server. Use this to run my Plex Media predominantly, and a few various other applications and it works flawlessly. And surprisingly quiet for a Xeon server. Would totally buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: D. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product but don't tell anybody.
customer_reviews.text: I really don't want to write these things High because everybody else will find out how good they are. These are absolutely one of the best priced fast machines built on server technology for anything you add an SSD to this and some RAM and I'm telling you it's the fastest machine you'll ever use hands down. The graphics aren't great on it but you can always add a graphics card to it and I guarantee you this is better than most gaming machines built.
customer_reviews.author: chspyder

customer_reviews.title: Worked as expected
customer_reviews.text: This is being used as a freenas storage system. I run a Plex server and a Ubuntu server off of it as well. I added 16 gb of RAM. The only issue I have is I can't choose which USB device to boot from so if I have a backup drive connected then the system tries to boot from the wrong drive and fails. Have not tried a bios update to see if that will change anything.
customer_reviews.author: bill

customer_reviews.title: Excellent & powerful SOHO server.
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine for our remote office. Has plenty of CPU power (quad core Xeon has lots of oomph). Easy to work in, at least in terms of adding additional drives and upgrading RAM. No real cons to mention. The only oddity I found was the HDD's get mounted upside down in the trays. Has zero performance impact, and it looks weird to me, but that's it.
customer_reviews.author: mauirixxx

customer_reviews.title: Great Speed, Versatility
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a small business, so the owner could use it as a workstation, but also as a data server for three other computers in his office. I put in a 1 Tb SSD as the main drive, install Windows 10 Pro, and installed the programs the business uses. The owner is very impressed with the speed and versatility he gets from the unit. Pros: Speed, versatility, ease of use Cons: With the XEON processors there is no hyperthreading.
customer_reviews.author: Big Ragu

customer_reviews.title: It does a great job and I plan to install several more in ...
customer_reviews.text: I have this unit installed in multiple dental offices and other locations. It does a great job and I plan to install several more in the near future!
customer_reviews.author: Bob Owens

customer_reviews.title: Great at the current price, has some annoyances.
customer_reviews.text: -Basically silent, good for a basic home server, low power draw. -Has an NVMe slot, but has limitations and was disabled in later BIOS versions. -SATA port labeling is annoying. -Has no externally accessible bays, even though they could have made it that way. -Space for many more internal drives, but no simple way to add them. - Tons of USB 3.0 ports. - No VGA or DVI, just DP and HDMI.
customer_reviews.author: JRod

customer_reviews.title: Nice cheap server to get you up and running quickly
customer_reviews.text: Nice cheap server to get you up and running quickly. Despite it only being able to support 4 HDD out of the box, you can upgrade it with aftermarket parts as you expand and if you look up mods for the older Dell T20. there is a big community for it as well. It doesn't support a fan in the front of the case, so you could have heating issues if the server isn't in a data center. But there are mods for that as well.
customer_reviews.author: kuyaz

customer_reviews.title: Died within 2 months of installation -- Do not buy, no warranty
customer_reviews.text: Install the server back in early April 2019. Had to reboot the server end of May. Server failed to boot up. BIOS LED blink pattern indicates DRAM did not pass Power On Self Test. Tried to get support from Dell website. Dell indicates that the product is not under warranty. I was surprised by this. I thought the product was new. I went ahead and replaced the DRAM with a new module. Server still does not power up. Must be a motherboard issue. Now I'm stuck with a dead server and a spare DRAM module.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Stephens

customer_reviews.title: It's a Dell... but watch where purchased for full Warranty...
customer_reviews.text: Got this from 2nd party seller and everything was as advertised other than the fact that Dell must be contacted to request a warranty transfer and it starts on the date it was originally made or sold by dell.... so i only got a few months of Dell warranty. Other than that it was New Old Stock condition and has performed fine.
customer_reviews.author: NOLAexpat

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the money
customer_reviews.text: I received this about a week ago and added a SSD and 4TB HDD to run as a plex server. You can add 1 additional hard drive fairly easy but to use the other 2 bays you have to remove the power supply which seems like a strange layout. When I initially turned the server on it wouldn't stay on but after some troubleshooting I found that the RAM hadn't been installed and was just stuck in the bottom of the tower. After installing this it fired right up and stayed on. Very happy so far with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: JWN

customer_reviews.title: Dead after 1 year.
customer_reviews.text: It just died after 1 year and a couple of months more. Literally, after restarting, it did not turn on again. Was connected to PCU, so no high voltage. It served a small business, luckily all data in drive was right. Avoid this one.
customer_reviews.author: Rodrigo Garzon

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: I like the system I got. I will recommend to add more RAM and hard drive though. I installed VMware ESXi on it and running multiple OS's on it. Its running well and haven't had any issues yet.
customer_reviews.author: Sahil

customer_reviews.title: Great Product exactly as shown....
customer_reviews.text: Cardinal Pro Electronics is awesome!! Server was exactly what I ordered. I would recommend using Cardinal Pro Electronics.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Ellsworth

customer_reviews.title: Great Value for Price
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased to run a AD DC and file server for a small business that was using a NAS for their needs. The included drive, although a good quality Seagate, was replaced with a few SSDs and put into RAID using Intel RST. For the overall price spent, the small business I installed this for was very impressed with the performance. With a few inexpensive upgrades, this tower would also make a very functional home desktop as well.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Posey

customer_reviews.title: Good price for entry level server, Only comes with a HDMI video out
customer_reviews.text: It’s a good machine for such a low price. Install windows server 2016 real easy, only concern is there’s only HDMI video out so you’ll need a converter cable
customer_reviews.author: javaroad

customer_reviews.title: Buy another NIC
customer_reviews.text: Just go ahead and buy another NIC if you're considering this machine. I had no end of problems getting the e1000e to connect at 1gpbs speed on my local network. Threw in a dual port card and boom no problems. Otherwise a great package at a decent price.
customer_reviews.author: S. Skripek

customer_reviews.title: Specs say comes with Windows 10 but it does NOT!
customer_reviews.text: Specs say comes with Windows 10 but it does NOT! Got it for my elderly mother, whose current computer is so old it's causing problems. Was planning to set it up for her today, Saturday. Not worth the hassle of returning the computer to get one with Windows installed, so instead we get the joy of hassling with Microsoft. NOT HAPPY.
customer_reviews.author: GMD

customer_reviews.title: What a great Tower server!
customer_reviews.text: Got the unit up and running on a spare copy of windows 10 home I had around. Set up a few shared folders for home central storage and some backups. Running Plex to stream some media around the house. All around excellent investment! Great little platform to get going.
customer_reviews.author: pat

customer_reviews.title: Hidden partition will cause failure to backup
customer_reviews.text: During installation, delete the DELL installed hidden partitions. They are formatted in a way that Windows Server refuses to backup. Otherwise seems like a decent piece of hardware, once you add some memory.
customer_reviews.author: Karl

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Server
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to run my Plex Server, and i'm completely satisfied with it so far.
customer_reviews.author: Eli N.

customer_reviews.title: Great server for the price!
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to set up. I added more memory to speed up the processing. The customer loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Phil Holly

customer_reviews.title: Excellent buy for the cost
customer_reviews.text: Excellent buy for the cost. Installed and configured Windows 10 Professional easily. Once the network adapter was installed, all the drivers were easily discovered and installed without difficulty. will upgrade to Server O/S at later date.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Erisman

customer_reviews.title: Nice small business computer, Ubuntu server works great on it.
customer_reviews.text: Put Ubuntu server on this computer and worked very well with it. Fast, lots of space to work with, very nice small business computer.
customer_reviews.author: Franklin

customer_reviews.title: Basic but does the job, fair value
customer_reviews.text: It's fine for what it is. Only has a 1tb hard drive, not 2 like it said when I bought it. But it's working fine.
customer_reviews.author: mcahunter

customer_reviews.title: I bought this unit but it keeps shutting off by ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit but it keeps shutting off by itself. I looked at the configuration and all look ok. I still have figured out why it shuts off. Wanted to buy a second one but now I'm doubting if it's worth it
customer_reviews.author: King Of Zamunda

customer_reviews.title: False or mixed advertisement
customer_reviews.text: False advertising. OS WIN 10 was listed on the description however when first powered, no OS. I called the seller but no resolution. I was given the runaround instead.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony O.

customer_reviews.title: Mine had a bad HDD
customer_reviews.text: I bought this server before Christmas and finally set it up today. It was running very slow so I tested the HDD and its bad! Good job Seagate. What even worse is this is Seagate's corporate drive line. How terrible.
customer_reviews.author: George Kerner

customer_reviews.title: Smashed parts installed on this “new” server.
customer_reviews.text: This server, which was sold as new, was clearly the seller’s dented and smashed offering. It was not dented in shipping. The bezel on the front of the server is cracked. The internal DVD drive does not work - won’t open, and you can see from the pic that I provided that this was installed after it was “new”. How unprofessional.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: A great barebones box.
customer_reviews.text: I used it to make a Windows 2012 R2 server and it works flawlessly. Easy to set, up easy to configure and very stable.
customer_reviews.author: MplsDude

customer_reviews.title: Great small business server
customer_reviews.text: Very fast and low noise. Great for a small business email server or media server. Got two of these puppies up and running fast.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Second time purchasing this server
customer_reviews.text: Came dead on arrival - did not power on. Ordered it because it was a next day delivery. Package was lost for 2 days and finally showed up. Also bought one a few months ago and it died.
customer_reviews.author: Gerry Green

customer_reviews.title: Great little server!
customer_reviews.text: Great value for the money. You will need to beef up the memory and add SSDs (more than the server costs) but runs great as a home ESX host.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love It.
customer_reviews.text: Top of the line, I set it up with a Samsung 256 GB SSD, absolutely fast, and silent. Love It.
customer_reviews.author: cmax

customer_reviews.title: Server is a great server. I have had it for a couple ...
customer_reviews.text: Server is a great server. I have had it for a couple of months. Loaded Windows Server and use it as a web server. No lag or delay. Runs Smoothly. Thinking about investing in another one If I decide I need it.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Just Waisted Lots of Time, but after I learned my lesson, it works great.
customer_reviews.text: My IT guy spent all day Sunday trying to load the Windows 2016 Server and it still wouldn't load. He's going to call DELL later today and perhaps DELL can fix their crappy server. I changed my review of the server because my IT guy explained the very complex procedures necessary to set the server up. You know, in the old days a civilian like me could actually set a server up by him self, but not these days. I really wish a server was not needed for my small business,.... but it is; very sad. Listen to my advice: GET HELP IN INSTALLING THE SERVER!
customer_reviews.author: David D. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: i need my refound please
customer_reviews.text: is a handy cam is not a dell tower please give me the refound .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dell T30 PowerEdge Server
customer_reviews.text: Great entry level server with Xeon processor, has run many different distros of linux on it from CentOS to Fedora and RedHat with virtual machine without any installation issues, will buy another soon for a cloud project box.
customer_reviews.author: G. Everett

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very quite great for a home office server plenty of power and expandability.
customer_reviews.author: Russell Stout

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Didn't know this machine doesn't have the VGA or DVI display port.
customer_reviews.author: Terry J. Seo

customer_reviews.title: Nice Little Home Server
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded my memory right away to Crucial 16GB. The server works great! You can't beat it for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Robertson

product_meta.title: 2017 Newest Dell PowerEdge T30 Tower Server System| Intel Xeon E3-1225 v5 3.3GHz Quad Core| 8GB RAM | 1TB HDD| DVD RW | No Operating System | Black
product_meta.description: By storing and sharing information on a server, the PowerEdge T30 helps you improve access to information, simplify processes and get more done in less time. Overcome the complexity of data and applications and get organized on a central T30 server. The PowerEdge T30 server packs large internal storage capacity and capable performance into a mini-tower chassis designed to deliver efficient and worry-free operation. With the T30, data and applications from multiple desktops, workstations and mobile devices can be consolidated onto a single server to boost collaboration and productivity. Depending on your needs, you can take advantage of the processing power and storage density of the T30 to attain greater efficiency and productivity for your home or office.
feature_bullets: New Dell PowerEdge T30 tower Server System
Intel Xeon E3-1225 v5 3.3GHz Quad Core, 8M cache
8GB UDIMM RAM, Single Rank, x8 Data Width
Onboard SATA, HDD connected to onboard SATA Controller - No RAID
1TB 7.2K RPM SATA 6Gbps Entry 3.5in Cabled Hard Drive, DVD RW, SATA Internal

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars106 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
